intro: Monnina multicomata, commonly known as the hairy monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant has hairy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. The species is part of the family Onagraceae, which includes other familiar plants like willows and evening primroses.
